revised_title: Two-Dimensional Slow Motion of Viscous Fluids: Applications and Limitations
tldr: The authors present a mathematical analysis of the two-dimensional slow motion of viscous fluids, focusing on boundary conditions and the flexure of thin plates. They also discuss the limitations of their method when applied to external spaces and the steady motion of a cylinder through a fluid. This research contributes to the understanding of fluid dynamics and its applications in engineering and physics.
